title: Guy ambulatory ward
body: After waiting a very long time for urgent blood results the receptionist, without asking, went and found out what was happening and came to reassure me; so kind of her and much appreciated. The consultant was so reassuring and explained the situation so very well. I feel so secure that we have this wonderful service and grateful of the people who work within it, especially in this trying times.

title: Great GP  practice
body: Very Helpful receptionists And Doctors, Very knowledgeable and Kind. Always treat you with respect and dignity.

title: Well Experienced GP
body: Highly professional. Friendly and always listen to the problems and try to find the appropriate outcome.

title: A Credit to The NHS
body: The wonderful Rheumatology Daycare Team are a very dedicated, efficient, professional and friendly team who have continued to deliver treatment to patients throughout the Covid 19 pandemic. The team makes patients feel very safe and they adhere to the Covid 19 protocols. This team is an great example of how to deliver patient care during extremely difficult circumstances. The team are very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and always make patients feel welcome. This team knows how to care for patients who have weakened immune systems which is essential during the current situation. I want to the team who are a real asset to the trust and a great credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent from the start
body:
Being admitted on 22nd Dec for induction of labour I was really nervous, but from the minute I arrived on the wards (ended up being on 2 then neo natal) the support and information I was given was amazing. The staff discussed everything with me and made sure I was comfortable with what was happening before continuing with anything. Ended up having a c section and the care I received was amazing, having been there for a couple of days staff returning to shift would remember the conversation we had prior and made me feel like they genuinely listened and cared about me whilst I was there and all of this during a COVID and Christmas period. My experience has been as if I’ve been in a 5 star hospital and the care they showed to my partner during this time was fantastic too. My baby has been cared for due to a little breathing issue but they ensured we were made aware of what was happening and that we were supported during decision making and with taking care of our baby. 
Overall they are an amazing bunch of thoughtful, kind, caring professionals from maternity to neo natal and have made this experience during an awful time the best for us and couldn’t have asked for more even outside of a pandemic.

title: Excellent Care - 5 Star!
body: My family and I have been registered at this practise for a number of years and have always been looked after with the utmost care. I have older grandparents and the Dr has treated them excellently and with great care. I have also found it very easy to get appointments with the Dr, and the whole process of booking is always very pleasant. The Dr has been of such help to my family and we are all extremely grateful  for the care and treatment he has given us. I would recommend this surgery to all!

author: AK42
title: Superb service!
body: I submitted an e-consult form this morning at Saltcoats Group Practice about medication side effects and Dr Cameron from the practice phoned me less than an hour later with advice. This is a superb service, particularly during a pandemic. I have had great care from the practice over the last few months, from GPs to nurses to reception staff, every one has gone the extra mile. Thank you.

author: apusxc88
title: Above and Beyond Fast Caring Service
body: I became ill on Tuesday with what I thought was food poisoning and went to the Doctor on Friday, They couldn't work out what was wrong and sent me to East Surrey as an emergency. My symptoms weren't classic and I had blood tests, x-rays, ultra-sound and finally a CT scan which found an appendicitis on Saturday. That night I had emergency surgery and was home Sunday afternoon. Absolutely amazing care and people listened to and believed me when I said I was ill although it wasn't so obvious because I refused to make a fuss about how I was feeling.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: ape2020
title: Trouble getting through on the Prescription line
body: I have been trying to arrange a prescription for an elderly relative, by telephone. Today l was continuously phoning from for 1 hr & 45 mins. The line was continuously engaged until 15:00 hours at which time the phone rang, the call was answered and immediately disconnected. I tried once more with again the phone ringing out, being answered and again immediately disconnected. I then tried ringing once again but it just rang out until the system switched off.

author: Jane456
title: Excellent service during the lockdown
body: I recieved an excellent service during the lockdown. The staff here especially the Doctors, and Nurses are terrific. Sometimes hard to reach them on the phone but very good service overall.

author: Frenchv
title: All the staff are amazing
body:
My Nan is a resident in the Towans Care home, Burnham on Sea. She has lived here for just over a year. All the staff are amazing, caring and passionate about their jobs. They have worked endlessly during Covid. Keeping up to date with local and national guidance.  
The interaction and activates they carry out and excellent. Keeping my nan mentally stimulated. They keep family members updated via social media which is lovely to see. Especially during lockdown when we haven't been able to visit. This has been so important to us as a family as it was such a hard decision for her to move from her own home.  
Keep doing what your doing, you really are angels

author: Smurfgirl
title: This GP practice is exceptional
body:
Exceptional practice, just been for my flu jab, so well organised, staff always friendly and professional. Best GP practice I have attended in a very long time ( also as an ex nurse I feel qualified to comment, having unfortunately seen poor practice over the years at various places).  
This GP practice in my opinion is exceptional, and should be a model for others to follow

author: 77Beatle
title: Surgery for gall bladder removal
body:
I had to have my gall bladder removed following intense intermittent pain for a number of months. I was referred to the Shirley Oaks Hospital to have this procedure completed. The initial consultations and preliminary checks were quite positive, with the Consultant being friendly and informative, and nursing staff who completed other assessments, presenting as thorough and competent.  
I thought I would be in very good hands and be looked after well for the procedure and in the aftermath, especially as this is a private hospital, but my faith was somewhat misplaced, unfortunately. Whilst the surgery itself went relatively smoothly, I was really quite ill afterwards, to the point that I was unable to stand up without starting to black out. Despite this, and narrating this difficulty to staff (and in fact, staff seeing this for themselves), I was put under considerable pressure to get up, get moving, and frankly, to get out. There did not seem to be much if any understanding on the part of the nursing team (with the possible exception of one nurse) that I was not faring very well after the operation, and after slightly over 24 hours later, I was sent home. This was without any explanation as to what recovery time could be, or acknowledgement about how much internal work had actually taken place through surgery. (It was only 2 weeks later that the nurse at my GP surgery explained this all to me, whilst she was removing my stitches).  
The aftercare was pretty shoddy. After getting home, I was shocked to learn that I could not lie down - and this was a problem for 2.5 weeks afterwards. Why was I not forewarned that this might happen? (A simple Google search told me that this was a possibility). Why was I not forewarned of the fallout of having a general anesthetic (i.e., intense fatigue for 3-4 weeks afterwards?).  
The experience, despite starting off with promise, was disappointing to say the least, as I was very much made to feel that I should have made a quicker recovery and should not be wasting a bed space. It is a sad story indeed, that a sick patient's wellbeing is treated as secondary. This is made all the more insulting as I am a health care professional myself, who strives to put my patient's feelings at the heart of everything I do. It's very basic really.

author: chassisym58
title: Phone left to ring endlessly
body: Have had bad experiences with Westrop Surgery for years. Some staff have a poor attitude, are impatient and have very often put the phone down as soon as I'm able to get through. That's not easy either - having to listen to endless music while trying to speak to someone, while the phone bill climbs.Told yesterday by a doctor to ring in to speak to another staff member this morning. Huh fat chance, phone left to ring endlessly. They say they will call you back but never do.

title: Good Care but struggle get online some time
body: The quality of service from the non-clinical team is generally OK.  On telephoning the surgery they are keen to push you onto their online system which is prohibitively time-consuming, often does not have your condition listed, requires you to consent to share your medical information with a third party and could be done in a fraction of the time over the phone.  Once you get past these 'gate-keepers' the medical care is very good.

title: Outstanding Care from Ambulance Service Nurses…
body:
In need of help at 4am, prompt arrival of ambulance excellent crew.
A&E attention faultless and through very caring and attentive all the team Nurses, Doctors and all those keeping everything clean in this time. 
Thank you to you all and Happy Christmas and New Year

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well done to My Surgery
body: I’d like to thank everyone at Jolly Medical center  . I’m in a particularly low place at the moment and the difference it makes to have you’re call answered in a polite and sympathetic way is priceless. Everyone who answers the phone is extremely kind and helpful and have always suggested a good course of action in which to proceed. When I joined from the other practice I feared the personal touch would surely be missing but everyone is genuinely there to help. The pharmacists have been particularly helpful in the changeover and I’ve felt the GP’s genuinely care about my health and well-being. I’d like to thank everyone at Jolly Medical Center for the excellent help they provide in a positive manner.

title: A Heartfelt thank you!
body: Writing this on Christmas morning to express our deepest gratitude  to a wonderful and professional team of caring individuals. You supported my wife so wonderfully whilst she was in intense pain with a medical emergency. Of course , I couldn't be with her during these times but from what I hear you cared for her as if she was a member of your own family. You carefully took her 'history' in to account from the wonderful paramedics and I understand you acted swiftly and called in those of your team who were best placed to help my wife. She tells me that despite the worrying times we are currently facing, she felt safe and reassured by an incredibly kind and efficient team. Bless you all and thank you sincerely from us both.❤️❤️

title: Great Department
body:
Having being taken to AE . Through an overdose.  All the staff showed Skilled Compassion and 110% care. Many thanks to the Observation Ward as well.
Outstanding care. Thank you

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Caring and compassionate
body: Even although today is Christmas Day, it is important to us to let you know how grateful we are for the kind and attentive manner in which you cared for me on F4 ward. I have a very complex history and I would just like to take the opportunity to thank the staff on the ward and the consultants and doctors and indeed the pharmacist for what I consider to be the exceptional care I received. You all made sure I felt safe and that I was being listened to. Thank you too for arranging my support on discharge. Myself and my husband are truly appreciative to every last one of you.

title: Phone problem
body: I was looking forward to the new phone system as this was a long time coming but the first week was great then you get through and after 7th in line and estimated time of 11 minutes and you go down the que and estimated time goes up and up and when you do go to 1 in line you get cut off. This has happened to me on several occasion. What a disappointment. There should be a line just to speak to a member of staff for query’s as number 4 is for home visit and anything else but that does not work either. After waiting for 45 minutes to get cut off is extremely annoying and frustrating. If you try again the same thing happens. Please help to sort this out.

title: Visiting Stroke Ward B11
body: My mother suffered a severe stroke yesterday morning (22/12).  We were telephoned by the staff nurse yesterday saying we could visit and to take some essentials in.  We were with mum all day yesterday, she is very poorly, kept being sick and if dad and I weren't there yesterday, she would have been in a right mess, and there would have been a right mess all over the sheets and floor, if she had been on her own.  I'm sure she knew we were there as she did manage to open her eyes a few times and mumble something.  My sister has come down from the Lake District to see her and took my dad to the hospital today (who is 85yrs old and has been married to mum for 58yrs, never been apart) only to be told they are not allowed to see her.  Not even for a few minutes, as they had gone there.  He is distraught and to think that my mum, who is realistically not going to pull through, is there on her own.  Surely you can show some compassion for both the patient and their spouse.  It is heartbreaking to see my dad in tears, his world has fallen apart in the matter of 24hrs.  He is in total shock.  Come on please, have some compassion.  Why were we told yesterday we could visit and nothing was said when we left last night about not being able to visit.  He needs to spend the final days with mum.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Telephone appointments
body: I understand because of Corona virus telephone appointmentds are being encouraged which makes perfect sense. However, just like with physical appointments at the surgery, they should have a specific time slot so that this can be scheduled in at work.  Otherwise the doctor or nurse might ring when the person is in a meeting or unable to take the call because they doing a delicate job on the shop floor.  Then when they don't take the call they are accessed of wasting someone's time when the appointment could have been given to someone else.  This is unfair and unreasonable. Virtual appointments will be a thing of the future but to work effectively the patient must be given a specific time slot which wasn't my experience today.

title: PDAU exceptional care
body: We came to end of a very difficult year. Considering all the difficulties yet we received great care from PDAU. We are grateful for what you do. It seems to us everyone at PDAU works in such harmony from consultant in Rheumatology to the nurses who administer medication and care. Your hard work has not gone unnoticed by your patient. The work you do and the care you provide is exceptional. No names is mentioned because you are a team. Simply you are all amazing. We thank you and wish you very best. Stay safe and enjoy the festive period. Best wishes Muntaha and family

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Clinically good. Admin needs to sharpen up a bit.
body: I have no complaints whatsoever about the clinical staff. Quite the opposite in fact. My regular injection was administered efficiently and I was offered a flu jab at the same time. My GP was also proactive and contacted me when it was necessary to do so. The few little problems I have encountered have been on the admin side. For instance, there was a reluctance to set me up to use online patient services, which would be useful for ordering repeat meds. When I subsequently ordered meds via email, my request was rejected but nobody contacted me to tell me it had been rejected or why. And because I am not set up to use online services, I received no notification via that route either. It was only several days later, when I contacted the Pharmacy, that I discovered there was a problem. Several days were therefore wasted. It would be nice if these little problems were ironed out, as it's a good local GP surgery, otherwise.

title: Kindness and compassion
body: On 30/11/20 my dad and mum were both admitted in the night, my dad short of breath my mum as a social case, she has dementia and he was her main Carer. They both tested positive for COVID the next day and despite the doctors and nurses best efforts my dad passed away on the 2/12/20. There are no words to say how grateful we are to all the staff involved in their care from the ambulance crew, a&e, the emergency floor (zone d) and finally Beacon ward.  The communication with the family was excellent, we were involved and supported all the way through.  This has really knocked our family but has been made so much easier by such brilliant teams who are working under additional extremes. Thank you Worthing Hospital, you should be proud - stay safe

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor communication - excellent care IF you can…
body: On line access, formerly excellent, now impossible. Telephone response poor. It seems to be aimed to fob you off. It is a shame because the medical care is excellent.

title: Amazing staff
body:
After spending 10 weeks here mostly on the VIC 
I just want to say a big thank you to the amazing staff.
They made what felt like a life time bearable and nothing was any trouble,  
Their work ethics and sense of team spirit really shows especially during this difficult time .
So once again a big thank you from me and my family to you all on the VIC and wishing you all a peaceful Christmas and a better new year
Kieran Mcneill

title: Great Practice
body:
Day 1 Left a message on the website.
Had a call back by a Dr within a few hours
Diagnosis over phone 
Information sent by text
Follow up planned for 4 weeks hence
Prescription sent to pharmacy
Medication collected same day
Symptoms subsided 3 days later after completion of treatment

Couldn’t ask for anything more, thank you

title: Hostile culture
body: Sadly, the processes and people put between patients and GP’s are hostile and blocking.  Push towards awful online tools, in fact the way they have setup eConsult means it has a cyber issue that you can send yourself messages from your GP!  Calling on the phone you have to wait for regularly an hour to speak so a hostile and unhelpful admin person, and emails go unanswered even when you send an important message and simply ask for confirmation of receipt!  Clearly the processes are setup to be hostile to the patients and block you from seeing your GP.  GP is great, when you can talk to them.  Raise it with management?  Completely unapproachable as email unanswered and wait for hours for a call.  They clearly need a separate and dedicated management escalation email address and phone number.

title: Rude and unprofessional receptionist
body:
We just made a phone call and " due to self-isolation, if emergency, to call ---- number " When called this number, told that vaccination is not emergency and rudely cut of conversations. 
If they are working at home and paid the salary by tax-payers, they should have answer the phone at the convenience of home- working environment and should not be rude to the tax-payers.
We would not know what is the emergency is and availability of vaccination is emergency for some conditions.
By the way, if the people is in life-threatening emergency, people will call " 999" anyway, no point in calling GP and talking on the phone to non-medical trained receptionists.

title: Telephone appointments
body: After a blood test I was asked to call the surgery to discuss the results.  When I phoned I was told I had to make a telephone appointment to speak with the diabetic nurse.  When I asked for a specific time slot for the appointment I was told this was not possible and it could be at any time during the day.   I told them that due to the nature of my job I may not be able to take the call if I am in a meeting or otherwise engaged.  I was then told that if I didn't  take the call that I would be wasting people's time and that a valuable appointment would be wasted.  I made an appointment but as it stands I just might not be able to take the call if it comes at the wrong time.  An improvement would be to give specific time slots just like for normal appointments so that that time could be allocated during the days schedule to take the call.  Instead I get criticised by the receptionist for possibly wasting people's time by not being able to take the call.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: My mother is 85 years old with an on going infection problem. She needed to see a doctor regarding antibiotics. We were ringing continuously from 8am for days no one answered and were always cut off. In desperation we queued at 7-45am with a 85 year old lady in the middle of winter only to be told in a disgraceful manner that we should not be there and should have phoned. My mother is in severe pain and only wanted to see a doctor it's disgusting and has been like this for years

title: excellent treatment centre
body: i had a total knee replacement on 3rd november from entering the hospital to leaving the next day the total experience was exceptional from the receptionists to the surgeon and his team , the nursing staff where very friendly ,caring and professional nothing was to much trouble , they where very covid aware . The food was excellent nice and fresh with a good choice, would definitely recommend this treatment centre to anyone is waiting to have an operation

title: DR. went home with left my appointment
body:
I got app with Dr., waiting call from her for 2-3 h. I called to GP, receptionist told me “ She went home”! I got suspicious Bell’s Palsy or Stroke, Dr. just left me WENT HOME!! GP didn’t arrange to see another Dr. , just say “Call 999”
How ridiculous service?? Dr Went Home, leave patient without notice! How comes??

title: Hard pass
body:
I was extremely disappointed by this practice and i am changing right now.
First, they never completed my registration properly, they don't appear on my "Patient access" and i can't book appointments that way.
Second, with covid you have now to fill up online forms to be called and then maybe something will happen. They're supposed to call within 2 days, i filled up the form a week ago and still nothing...
Thirdly, the first time i needed to be seen, when this time i had the phone appointment, after 5mins of me explaining that i had unusual pain on my lower abdomen, the person on the phone seemed very bothered by me and asked "Why are you calling us?" (Maybe because i'm in pain and i'm requesting medical advice ???). She finally said i could give them a urine sample the next morning, which i did and i never heard of them again. Nothing, no follow up, no results. Obviously, i went to see another practitionner.

I can understand that with covid, they're busy, but asking to someone "why are you calling us" after they've explained they're in pain and need medical examination is a whole other level, it's simply a form of mistreatment.

title: People Not Wearing Masks Properly
body: The hospital is being let down by a large number of patients and staff either not wearing face coverings or wearing them under their nose or chin. I have seen many patients especially the Phlebotomy waiting area not social distancing and wearing their masks under their noses or chin. This is putting other patients and the Phlebotomists at risk of Covid 19. In addition many staff use the link corridor to have conversations or to make phone calls which block the one way system making it difficult to pass and to social distance this is despite the markings on the floor. Please can the hospital ask people to wear their masks correctly. I have asked other patients to wear their masks properly only to be met with verbal abuse or just ignored. Patients need to feel safe when they visit the hospital and are being let down by people who don’t think that Covid 19 exists. Many patients put their mask under their nose or chin as soon as they get into the hospital.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: COVID vaccination
body: All praise to the team administering the vaccine - all highly efficient and professional.  Very grateful to the team for all they did to make receiving the vaccine so smooth.

title: Great practice
body: I had to have a gastroscopy the other day and I just wanted to say that all the staff in alexandra day unit were professional kind caring members of staff they do a fantastic job and are a credit to the team.

title: Safe Environment, Good Covid Measures, Very…
body: I had a back ache and i was reluctant to goto any crowded place. But i had to visit bilton medical. To my relief it wasn't crowded, the appointment system works in a way that it isn't crowded and the staff is very helpful. the doctor listened to me carefully. Overall i am happy with experience.

title: Bad services
body: If you plan on getting help here i wouldnt bother I went in on Christmas day 2020 I was the only person there I went in with swollen glands bad chest and bad back pain the reason for the visit was I had nearly passed out 4 times within the hour I was concerned obviously. I go in the room the 2 nurses just sit there didn't check anything asked me what was wrong. They went on to tell me I should never have gone there and would have to wait to pass out to be seen and sent me on my way they could see I was in pain and upset but they just wanted me out of there ASAP. Iv never been to the hospital before for anything so the first time I asked for help I was in big shock when they turned around and said I basically have to be unconscious to get help. I still feel really ill but honestly never want to go to a hospital or doctors again I feel so let down and humiliated.

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Everyone was helpful and friendly. I felt very safe, especially in these 'covid' times. Cataracts in both eyes successfully removed in 3 months.

title: Thank you
body: Great care and attention given to me when I broke my wrist on Chritmas Eve.  I commend the team for their warm professional care of me in my distress. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Wonderful care and outcome.
body:
I recently had a cataract operation at Spamedica in St Cath's Birkenhead.
I wanted to thank all the staff and especially the surgeon. The whole process was totally stress free and the surgeon was amazing.
The improvement in my eyesight is nothing short of a miracle.
I cannot recommend you enough. Thank you again Agnes Lynch

title: Great practice
body: Well organised, friendly and professional staff. From checking in to leaving the hospital all staff were polite and informative. Also prior to appointment I was kept informed about my upcoming appointment

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care
body:
I have had to attend various hospitals and other practices a lot this year which has reinforced how wonderful our home practice is. Irrelevant of which doctor or health care pro you need to consult or receptionist you speak with, they always have time to listen, take you seriously and follow up to ensure you are ok. Something I have not experienced elsewhere. 
Thank you Riverbank.

title: Very fast response
body: Went with swollen gland in neck. Sent immediately for blood tests. Doctor nor happy with clarity of results so sent to have again and also scan. This resulted in biopsy and finding thyroid cancer.  Treatment was so fast doctor was so fast and followed up with phone calls to see how I was and what was happening. So impressed. A big thank you.

author: Fee1276
title: 999 call on Christmas night
body:
My father in law who has mild copd and asthma took a panic attack on Christmas night. He was struggling to breath. Upon calling 999, the call handler was fantastic and really helpful. She remained calm under pressure and was able to calm the Family within the home.  
The first responder Andrea arrived. She had the most appropriate direct and professional attitude for my father in law. She showed care and compassion throughout her intervention. Her ambulance colleagues also attended (sorry I don’t have their names). Both were very professional and helpful to Andrea and the family throughout her input to my father in law.  
Thanks again for all your help! It allowed my father in law to remain at home and avoided admission to hospital. Something we are very keen to avoid at this time!

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: AnnieMcC
title: My dad's stay in causeway hospital coleraine
body:
I just want to personally thank all the nurses in the medical assessment unit of the causeway hospital especially Eimear, Janet and Donna (charge nurse) for all their relentless care and attention you gave to my dad James Christie over the last 5 weeks. We all as a family are eternally grateful for all your hard work and dedication and for everything you did for my dad during his stay. His recovery has been quite a journey but he has come a long way since his first arrival.  
Thank you once again it was greatly appreciated and he is now getting stronger every day.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Liana
title: My heart is full of gratitude
body:
My heart us full of gratitude to a nurse called Oksana, she is working in cardiology in Barts Hospital, but for couple of days her shift was moved to Covid section 6D, where I was admitted with Covid, terrible pains, fever and side effects of my ongoing imunatherapy! ( as a cancer diagnosed patient).  
Almost 2 weeks of unbarable pains, medications, injections, headaches, fever, no visitors allowed ( due to Covid 19), couldn't even talk to my family over the phone, that bad was my condition!  
Oksana demonstrated herself as a professional, extremely responsible, warm hearted person, so much care, she could pick the right words to comfort me when I felt so low and scared!She wouldn't just pass my room door without checking on me and making sure I'm ok, have enough water, or can't reach something!  
She definitely has contributed a lot to my succsessfull recovery and discharge before Christmas 2020!  
NHS should be proud of such an employee!  
I wish my feedback could reach her management and make difference for her!  
Thank you so much, Oksana!  
God Bless you!  
Best wishes

author: Renyx78
title: Exceptional care
body: I was admitted with chest pain and diagnosed with a heart attack. The staff were simply amazing throughout my stay. I cannot praise our NHS staff enough for their care, compassion and efficiency

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Renyx78
title: Flu clinic Udston Hospital
body:
Busy clinic but effectively run with lovely helpful staff to welcome you and ensure your safety throughout  
Thank you

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Margd45
title: Monklands mammogram service
body:
I received an appointment for my follow up mammogram appointment, which didn’t suit me due to child care. I called the department and was put through to a mammographer who re arranged my appointment to her list and did me at a day and time I could get child support. You have fabulous staff at Monklands to arrange this for me , Arlene was fabulous and so lovely.  
Can’t say how much this meant to me

author: Char H
title: Anxiety and depression
body:
I have suffered with anxiety and depression on and off for many years. However, poor health, lockdown and being away from my partner only made me feel worse.
I was put in touch with Georgina at thurrock mind who completely listened to all my worries and issues.
Together she has helped me learn how to cope better with panic attacks, anxiety, low mood and social anxiety.
I am not completely cured and I know that recovery will take time. But so long as I continue to use what she has taught me, I know things will be ok.
Therapy really does help, so long as you put the work in too. It isnt always easy, in fact in can be really hard mentally, however it is one of the best things you can do for yourself and for your loved ones.
I recommend thurrock mind, they are a great service and all of the therapists there are so understanding and do not judge you at all. I am happy to have got through my therapy, but I am grateful to know that if I am struggling, they are only a phone call away.
I will continue to do my best to combat my mental health and try to live more in the moment.
Thank you so much to thurrock mind!

author: Menopause solutions
title: My experience of a gynaecological procedure.
body:
I arranged a telephone appointment to have a merina coil fitting. The telephone appointment took place as arranged and a date was scheduled for the procedure.  
The appointment was at The Sexual Health Clinic, Whytemans Brae , Kirkcaldy, Fife. I had never visited this clinic before and the directions given were spot on. The first Doctor I met who examined me & carried out the procedure was professional, treated me with dignity and explained everything she did very clearly, asking me frequently if I was okay throughout. Due to my own previous experiences of this procedure, I had a little concern but knew the importance of it taking place for me, and I felt the Doctor understood this. It all went very well. I had a follow up appointment a couple of weeks later and met with a different Doctor who examined me and we agreed all was well. Unfortunately a few weeks later, due to the coil moving slightly out of place, I was able to receive another appointment to have another refitting. This was with the follow up Doctor at the same clinic. Again I experienced wonderful care, given with respect and dignity. We discussed my situation, I felt able to be very honest about it and felt I was listened to, as I had been in the previous appointments. The procedure was carried out with great care and efficiency. The clinic functioned remarkably well given the current Covid restrictions placed on the NHS, all of which were adhered to by all Staff. Friendly & helpful Administrative staff as well as Nurses and Doctors.

title: Great experience in the emergency department
body: I was told to ring the emergency department on Christmas Eve for some advice on some symptoms I was experiencing during early pregnancy. From start to finish I was so impressed with the experience I had. They answered the phone straight away, the receptionist listened to my concerns, spoke to a consultant for me & booked me in there and then for a last minute scan. When I arrived, I was really nervous as this was the first scan I’d ever had & I had to go in on my own due to COVID! However, the staff couldn’t have done more to make sure I was at ease with the whole process. The nurse who triaged me was really friendly, and the two doctors who performed my scan were very patient considering I was a nervous wreck and they did everything to make sure I was happy and comfortable throughout. Once the scan was done, the doctor sat with me to talk through everything and answered any questions I had. Considering it was late on Christmas Eve and all the staff were on their way home, I never felt rushed out of the appointment and the doctor was more than happy to listen to my concerns and answer my questions. All in all I was very impressed and felt so cared for the entire time, and as someone who hates going to hospital, this experience could not have gone better!

title: Highly recommended
body: I have been a patient at this practice for over 30 years and I rate it very highly. My GP is excellent. She is always friendly and courteous and often goes beyond the expected. I received a call from her on Christmas Eve to discuss possible side effects of my medication, which I had mentioned to one of the nursing staff during my review. I have to have regular blood tests and I only have good things to say about the nursing staff. I am treated so well, with efficiency and care, and what could be the distressing experience of having one's blood taken regularly is carried out with efficiency and compassion. It really makes all the difference. I have never been made to feel like I am a nuisance, if I call with a query and the receptionists are always polite and friendly. I would have no hesitation in recommending this surgery to anyone. They provide a marvellous service in my experience.

author: Sorcha
title: My labour in Craigavon Area Hospital
body: After a 20 hour labour I hemorrhaged while removing the placenta. As a first time mum and experiencing 2 litres of blood loss I was rushed to surgery immediately, extremely scared and fearing I wouldn't come around.. the staff in the delivery suite at Craigavon area hospital, midwives, doctors, anaesthetists and surgeons did everything they can to make me feel like everything was going to be just fine. Someone held my hand the whole way through and reassured me it was going to be OK. I will never forget this kindness and I want to thank them with all my heart for bringing my precious girl into the world and ensured I left hospital in one piece. I will forever be grateful to every single one of them xx

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: stew77
title: COVID Vaccination
body:
I am one of the lucky people who have already been given my first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. I was contacted by Michelle (paediatric secretary) and was given an appointment, very straightforward.  
I then attended the Louisa Jordan Hospital and was met by an extremely professional group of individuals, from the security men, admin staff, the HCAs and Nurses.  
I was vaccinated by a retired nurse called Anne, I didn't catch her surname but she was so kind and provided reassurance throughout the process, and gave the best aftercare and follow up advice.  
My experience from start to finish was seamless, and would just like to give a special mention to Michelle in admin and Anne the nurse who could not have been any better and are both a credit to our NHS.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Sapphie
title: 2 Hour Wait for treatment when asked attend early.
body:
i was phoned the night before planned Chemo treatment and asked to be at the unit at 9.40am. This was 1 hour earlier than previously planned. I arrived as asked and ended up sitting and waiting for 2 hours before being seen. I did ask why I was waiting and was told I was next. This took a long time. I watched many others arrive and be called for treatment.  
When I went into be treated I was told my blood platelets were too low to have treatment and I needed to have more bloods. I had my bloods done and platelets were still too low, so I was quickly sent on my way with little information and support as by this time I was confused and felt I as rushed through with little thought. I then had to find my way home. I felt very let down by the Headland Unit and rushed though with little thought for my feelings and needs.  
Not happy as implications of low platelets was not explained to me either. I had to look it up and phone my Oncology nurse to find out. Poor service on this visit. it is so sad.

author: Mal20
title: Parking penalty
body:
In November, I took a friend to Emersons Green Medical Centre. His booking in time was 0630. I picked him up from his house about 40 miles from Emerson Green. As the traffic was light, we got there about 0535 and had to wait in the car park until the doors opened just before 0630.  
At the end of the month I received a Parking Charge Notice for £100. I am not happy with this as;(a) it was very dark and I was not aware of any signage.  
(b) there is no mention on Emerson Green website about parking restrictions.  
(c) as the centre was physically closed, there is no way that I could have registered the vehicle.  
(d) when my friend went in, I could not accompany him due to COVID restrictions.

author: Grumpy lol
title: My heartattack
body:
In Jan 2020, whilst getting ready to head off to work I felt an uncomfortable pain in my chest and numbness in my left arm. I rang 999 as they were some of the signs of the a heartattack. I wasnt afraid and not in a lot of pain.  
The paramedics arrived, did an ECG and blood pressure. My blood pressure was very high and on that basis they took me in. Blood tests at the hospital confirmed I had suffered a heart attack. From there things moved very fast. I CANNOT thank the brilliant care I received. I am a woman in my forties generally fit and well working as a gym. manager. My family and friends were in total shock.  
I suffered mentally for months and still have dark days, but the good ones are now outnumbering the bad. Lockdown didn't help as I'm a people person and missed being around my lovely staff and members. My partner has been my crutch, without him supporting and encouraging me things would have been so different.  
I received help from mental health, and cardio rehab these ladies also were my people who I could lean on, what ever time of day or night. The doctors and staff at the GP surgery have been absolutely fantastic. Nothing is to much trouble. Dr Beckett has been a rock and each time I have seen her I have walked out with a reassuring feeling that I will get through this tough time and live to be a grey old lady. THANK YOU all from the bottom of my heart lol. Xxxx

title: Exemplary care during my stay, under difficult…
body: Was admitted to Victor Horsley ward for an aneurysm stent. Outstanding care and covid safety protocols in place, all staff were reassuring and kind. The ward is busy, and noisy so bring ear plugs if you don't sleep well but checks have to be undertaken for your well being.  Cannot fault the professionalism and care I received.

title: a  warning  to  the  management
body:
I am a grateful patient  of  the  hospital for whom I  can  only  offer
 praise.
I refer to the podiatry dept whose expertise can only be wondered at. BUT  I warn management, a year ago this dept had 4 staff, today there is only 1. What will the hospital do if this lady goes sick ? tell the public  "  we  dont have staff to handle your problem". I have had foot  dressings  from consultants, surgeons, doctors,  nurses etc.
But  none do such a good  or lasting  job as those from podiatry. I had a dressing recently  from a  senior nurse ;podiatry took one look and  said, it is  wrong, it is too tight, for a person with poor leg ciculation  this could cause serious problems.
I beg the management to urgently look at  the staffing  situation of the podiatry dept, and rectify  matters, It would be a tragedy if the wonderful existing reputation  of this dept, which is as vital as any other, were allowed  to  wither  on  the  vine.
Yours  gratefully  and  most  respectfully,
h  solomons

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Temperature reading for Covid vaccine.
body: Abysmal today, The two people before me were sent packing as they had a high temperature reading, I followed and was advised I also had a high temperature. As I had had my temperature taken an hour previously and the reading was 36.2 I asked whether I could have another reading -this time it was normal however, was told that as one of the readings were high I couldn’t have the vaccine. Absolutely shocking and disappointing, I am a front line worker who needs this vaccine -what a shambles.

title: Great practice
body: I am with high blood pressure and also Diabetic. My GP always take care of my health issues. Most of the times they send me a reminder for blood, urine test.

title: Abusive and arrogant
body: Wife discharged from hospital seven days ago to care home, doctor phoned me asking where she was. Gave details, was told now out of area and therefore no longer registered. Bad attitude.

title: Visit 24 12 2020
body: Accepting it was Christmas Eve and undoubtedly the staff were busy with the typical time of the year issues coupled with the current pandemic. I was disappointed with the lack of assistance from reception staff when merely enquiring about a patient that was with them, providing their name, and address, but unable to give a date of birth. Accepting they had probably had a difficult shift, I found them abrupt and not helpful. I myself work for an emergency service and understand their frustrations, but a little help and courtesy goes a long way. I am a huge supporter of the NHS and the incredible job they do in particularly trying circumstances. But they can make things easier.

title: Unfairly treated
body: Recently went to fracture clinic at Chorley Hospital with a booked appointment time, had to wait 2 hours to be seen by a dr.  In between the 2hours of waiting when enquired with the receptionist how long its going to be she said for me to go and ask the nurse.  When ask the nurse she said "we had some urgent cases today so we had to let them go in before you".  Unhappy with the service I just sat back down in waiting area again waiting and waiting, I noticed that people whose appointment time was after mine were being seen to before me, new people were coming in and were being seen to before i was. It eventually came to the point I was the only one left at the clinic waiting area still waiting to be seen - it felt like they only eventually saw me because there was nobody else left to call for.  I was appalled by the service I was given & felt I was hugely unfairley treated.  I personally believe the files system should be replaced by a number/ticket system so people exactly know when their turn is next and to potentially prevent any kind of unfair treatment of patients like myself.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unable to contact friends
body: Simply phoned to speak to a patient on the ward who's been there for more than a year now and wish him a merry Christmas. Didn't ask for any details or any information. The member of staff basically hung up on me.

title: Very confusing
body: I accessed the hospital for severe alcohol withdrawal and was initially treated very well. Then for some reason I was transferred to a completely inappropriate ward and was effectively held hostage for 5 days with very little explanation absolutely no treatment and no possible way of discharge, just plied with drugs. I admit to feeling completely traumatised by the experience. I was supposed to be waiting for several test results but these were not forthcoming. Very confusing and traumatic experience despite the great care at the beginning

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Top class A and E
body: Wife was violently sick with high blood pressure and chest pains went to A and E department she was looked after and received top class treatment thanks to all concerned

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: I'm really relating to the corona -19 vaccine
body: I'm 96 years old and suffer from bad asthma I keep looking at all the other districts with people getting vaccinations but in Hillingdon I have not been done nor can they even give me an idea if or when I will have it. Its shameful of the Hillingdon NHS!! WHY

readBy.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not recommended
body:
Receptionists - will do everything in their power to interrogate you so you do not meet the criteria to see your chosen GP that day.
GPs - some good (usually the one's you'll never be able to see)

When you do get to see a GP,  don't bother taking off your coat - you'll be in and out in 60 seconds, and left feeling like YOU have bothered them.

No continuity of care, no one takes you seriously.

I understand these are exceptional times but basic patient care and customer service is not being met.

title: bed blocking
body:
Hi all
I've just experienced 6 days in Pinderfields after enduring a pneumothorax for the third time.
After my treatment was completed successfully I was tod that I could leave hospital and go home at 12 noon on Friday, at 3 pm I was still waiting for official paperwork to be issued before I could be officially discharged, after further enquiries I was informed that it could be a further 2 hrs before I could go home, I decided to inform the staff that I was leaving and walked out.
The NHS is always moaning about being short of beds, If I had stayed in the ward I would have occupied a bed for approx. half a day so why does it take so long for any paperwork to be completed before you can release a bed ?
I remember being left on a bed in a corridor until 10.30 pm on the day I was admitted, I had been at the hospital since 11 am.
what springs-to-mind is.....they couldn't organise the proverbial at a brewery.
all that being said the whole of the NHS staff that I came into contact with were absolutely first class, 100%, spot-on, excellent, they have my full admiration for the magnificent job they were doing in these very challenging Covid times

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)

title: Hello!
body:
Title of review is Hello!
Why? Continuously being ignored by the practice, way before COVID, they have an online communication facility and for 4 weeks I have awaited a response and sent a further 4 follow ups and nothing. I receive an automated response to say will get a reply within 2 working days. 
I have made complaints in past and it goes over the surgeries head and never get a response. Never get an appointment. They’ve locked their main doors. Can’t get through on phone, can’t get through on their web services. Awful surgery. Avoid at all costs.

title: years of awful admin many staff little/no MH…
body: Been in mental health service continuously all adult life in this county (30+ years) and other counties. Before 2011 this clinic had dedicated career mental health experts at all levels, most with compassion for patients. They concientiously observed, recorded and anticipated patient difficulties. They encouraged and included patients' perspectives on their own condition and needs in clinical decisions and reviews etc. Since 2011 gradual decline into dysfunction. Plenty of cold staff over years who look the other way rather than help desperate patients. Camoflaging discharge of patients as "care" or "help" is common. So patient and family is unware they're being exited. Staff avoid input with patients' GPs, including around discharge. Patient friends here gave up their long fought for places at clinic because their clinician was "dismissive" or "hostile" towards their needs. They would rather leave permanently than face that so-called care input for one more day. If you know anything about your own condition (via other agency patient education efforts) you will be the least popular patient with staff there. Rare good staff leave inside a year or 6 months. Clinic assigns longterm to autistic or personality disordered patients staff with no mental health training or experience drawn from NHS fields like physiotherapy. Your mental health can become so bad you have no memory of when you last ate and lost all natural sense of thirst - and ask your psychiatrist where you can find help for that, and be angrily told "How do I know - you have to stand on your own two feet!"  Self and others at this clinic have been lied to and decieved many times. Admin and clincial input so dysfunctional for so long (months/years) that we break down in tears with relief with rare good staff. Who soon leave. I can confirm the truth of all other patients' comments on these review pages. Patient perspectives on own health and circumstances is often openly and actively refused, refuted or not recorded. There is no accountablilty or appology for the most appaling breaches of the Trust's or NHS rules and guidance. If you have disabilities, or potentially lethal health conditions, you can look forward to staff standardly not being told those, not considering them, or not including those in their referals to other staff or NHS faculties, contrary to NHS guidelines. The above deficiences (polite term), and too many others to list here, are likely to cause you to leave with worse mental health than when you arrived. I want to say to any patient reading, abandon hope all ye who enter here (the clinic). But instead I’ll say, Good luck and bless you – you’ll need both at Chapel Street. Max.

title: No confidence
body:
I have used the Hathern surgery for over 20 years. Getting appointments was always fairly easy and I generally knew the GPs’. Most importantly it worked hard to understand patient needs and seemed genuinely keen to offer an accessible, friendly service that provided continuity of care across the practice.
Since being run as part of a group of practices the service has declined markedly and rapidly. As others have said, it is almost impossible to get an appointment. I know none of the doctors and they change regularly. At my last appointment I told the doctor. That I was allergic to the medication offered but I was prescribed it anyway. I have lost count of the times I have been promised a call back only to suffer deafening silence. Communication generally is awful. For example I did not know that flu jabs were being offered. I rang to check only to be told there were none left - I went to a pharmacy instead. I dread to think how they will manage with Covid vaccinations.
I understand that we have experienced very trying times that have put huge pressures on health services but many of the problems seem to me to result from a culture of organisational apathy. One of my friends has already moved to a different practice while at least one other is considering it. Because I have lost all confidence that I can get adequate care I too am considering my options.
It is so sad that what used to be an exemplary heath service is now so ineffectual.
I would give no more than one star and that seems quite generous.

title: Fantastic staff on ward 19
body:
Never visited but mum is being looked after so well by an amazingly caring and kind team
Thank you to you all
You are angels and more
Xx

title: Grear experience, friendly and helpful staff
body: Great experience, friendly staff very helpfull nevee had any problems with booking appointments or face to face or phone call

title: Fantastic practice
body: This is a great practice with sympathetic and professional staff. Their registration process is very smooth and they looked after myself and family members quite well. I would recommend this practice to those who are considering a great service from GP

title: Exceptional service
body: I visited the A & E Department on Boxing Day and have nothing but praise and gratitude for all those involved in dealing with my problem.  Their level of professionalism, care, kindness and understanding was second to none.  I left feeling reassured and very grateful that we have such a wonderful NHS service.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: First time
body: My wife and I had our first flu jabs and I was so well organized that we will definitely be doing it again as and when needed , staff were efficient polite and organized

title: Great Practice
body: Yes, there are occasional glitches and offhand receptionists but they really are the exception rather than the rule.   This is a good, caring practice with really helpful staff at every level.  They have dealt with Covid problems as efficiently as  anyone could wish given the fact that they are shoehorned into premises that really  tight.   We've been patients there ever since about 1970 and have always felt helped, supported and understood.   Prescriptions are dealt with quickly and efficiently, calls back from Doctors, essential in these days, happen quickly too and are always satisfying and great in the way they allay anxiety.   For us, aged 87 and 91, this is an ideal practice.

author: cafebe83
title: No temperature check on arrival
body: I attended the eye clinic for an eye scan today. I fully expected to have my temperature   checked on arrival but that didn’t happen. I didn’t have a scan- it may not have been essential but the eyes were checked. I understand staff may be stretched just now but I did not feel safe while waiting to go in and out of the different consulting rooms.

author: JamesC24
title: Care of my father a covid patient
body: I want to thank all those in Causeway hospital medical assessment unit for their care of my father. Janet, Eimear, Patricia and Donna, your care was priceless and very much appreciated. My dad received excellent care and attention during his recovery from covid 19. Your care was super and very much appreciated.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent
body: Really cooperative staff at the reception and the GP herself has really handled my problem from the diagnosis towards the complete healing.

title: Day Treatment Unit
body: A massive thank you to all the staff involved in my  routine minor surgery on 15.12.2020.   From booking to discharge, each and every one of you were exemplars not only of excellent professional practice, but of compassion and empathy.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice, very adaptive
body:
This surgery has gone from having no doctors registered a few years ago to coming under new management that are very effective. The doctors are available on the same day for phone appointments.  Since Covid, they appear to have extended phone appointments to a simple system of call in at 8am or 2pm to talk that day.

They use an app that enables the doctor to view you in video, or you can upload a video or photos when  the doctor sends you a text with a link.

They have nurses for blood tests and vaccinations.  Overall, I really like their flexibility and how pleasant everyone is.  It may be the same building as when they couldn't find doctors to work there - but it's an entirely new and trustworthy practice.  From receptionsist to nurses and doctors, this is a really friendly practice.

They're also affiliated with a practice with walk-in facilities.

The NHS  now has a computer system that enables your revords to be picked up at other locations.  Treatment I'd received from Edridge Road was instantly available when I wlaked into A and E in Bath, Somerset.

author: MinnieT
title: My Dad's almost 6 weeks in Hospital
body:
I just want to thank the staff of the Medical Assessment Unit for their dedication and care of our Dad. It was a very difficult time for the family not being able to see him and feeling helpless. However staff like Emir, Janet and Donna giving my brother daily updates helped immensely.  
My Dad has came through a lot and still has a journey to go in his recovery. It was touching when Staff Nurse Janet phoned my brother after discharge to hear how he was getting on. Many thanks to you all. I hope you are all looking after your own health and mental well-being.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Pupslup
title: Prostate cancer
body: It all started so well before the covid19 took off early detection and follow up but because of covid and the high chance of contracting virus treatment has unfortunately been delayed but I am positive things will be back on track for treatment. The staff have been and still are under great circumstances beyond their control.

author: GOW5
title: Committed senior ward staff
body:
During the Covid pandemic, when I have been unable to visit my dad in hospital, the staff in ward 4 at QMH in Dunfermline, NHS FIFE have promptly, willingly and sensitively dealt with any query/concern/request from myself. I am very grateful for this as not being able to see my dad in person for the last 9 months has been unduly hard.  
When I have had concerns they have listened, then they have kept me informed as they try to resolve the matter and ensured I am satisfied with the outcome. Most importantly they have done things that I couldn't do due to not being able to visit eg get my dad to sign cards and then sending them to my mum as well as make special occasions more memorable when my mum could visit such as their wedding anniversary.  
The leadership in the ward is obvious, with senior staff wanting what is best for their patients and their families through engagement in new initiatives which is essential in advanced dementia care. It was lovely as a family to be contacted by the staff about the "Playlist For Life" and us all thinking about music dad had enjoyed over the years. This connection with dad, while none of us could visit, allowed us to feel involved with his care.  
Though I cannot currently visit my dad it is reassuring to know he has such a committed team of staff taking care of him and for that I am very grateful.

title: Flu vaccination
body:
Just wanted to say how impressed I was with the system in place for the flu jab
Straight in friendly staff done and straight out in minutes fab service keep it up Danbury

title: Great a&e but terrible after care
body:
Back in march I had a bycicle crash which resulted in a fractured collarbone. The A&E visit at Maidstone hospital was overall pretty good, in and out in an hour, with x-ray and treatment. The nurse at the x-ray section was not gentle at all she pull my broken arm in few directions although i was in extreme pain.
The doctor who looked at the x-ray in a&e told me it was a dystal fracture and fragments of bone were floating around but a specialist will contact me to let me know if surgery needed.
Next day I was contacted by the virtual fracture clinic and been told that I will not need operation and I have been given a list of exercises to do from day 0 up to 12 weeks. After 3 weeks i was supposed to have a check up x-ray which didn't happen due to covid... I have followed all the instructions to the letter. And over the summer took things really easy with painful episodes thinking is normal giving the area of the fracture . In September after I started my job full time the pain started also to be unbearable having to stop for long periods of time. I have contacted the fracture clinic and been referred to a specialist after 2 weeks. During this visit i have faund out that my collarbone is still very much broken and now i need surgery to put plate in and possible bone graft.. The specialist who seen me at the time has explained to me all my options and put me on urgent waiting list. I have been told i could wait up to 12 weeks. 8 weeks have been and gone with no news. I am in constant pain and I cant sleep very well. Called hospital and my gp but no one seems to know anything, only been prescribed strong painkillers for the foreseeable future.... This is something which could have been avoided if the follow up x-ray would have happened. Beeing self employed this is very much affecting me not only financially but also mentally. I was out of action for months when this happened and now i struggle with daily activity which will eventually be followed by another recovery period....

title: Great
body: Had Revision Hip Replacement 2 weeks ago , From 1st Appointment to having Operation everything was Spot on. Care from Caring Staff. Nothing was too much trouble, Food very enjoyable. Cannot fault anything,

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Thank you
body: Just like to say a very big thank you to all the staff in A&E on the late shift on Christmas Eve, your care, attention and efficiency was amazing, would also like to thank the paramedics.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: MikeWaz
title: Quitting Smoking
body:
I decided I needed help to stop smoking and phoned Quit Your Way Scotland. I have used this service twice before so I knew the staff there. Because of the pandemic there were no face to face meetings and everything was done over the phone and by text. Actually this turned out to be a great service.  
Susan talked me through how it would work, that my medication would be delivered and she would phone me every week but also I could phone her any time if I felt I needed more help. 12 weeks on Champix passed by so quickly and here I am 3 months smoke free. I know I can phone Susan any time if I feel I need help but so far, so good. I can't recommend this service highly enough.

author: jethro66
title: Christmas in SAU and Montacute
body:
I was taken by ambulance to SAU a few days before Christmas and underwent emergency hernia surgery at midnight followed by transfer to Montacute ward.  
The ambulance team and every member of staff at Musgrove showed kindness and professionalism in their dealings with me, not only in the wards but also the X-ray Dept, Operating theatre, and the Ultrasound Scanning Dept. I cannot speak too highly of the care, concern and kindness from everybody that I came into contact with from surgeons, doctors, nurses, health care assistants, cleaners, porters, and staff in the X-ray departments.  
As you can imagine it is a daunting thought to be away from your loved ones at this special time of year and it was no different for me. The fact that all these staff members volunteered to give up their Christmases to come in to work and care for patients is really touching and very much appreciated. Everybody worked with a cheerful spirit and many of them went that extra mile to make me feel special including providing a delicious Christmas lunch complete with cracker and a few words of kindness.  
In particular, one of the cleaners went to great lengths to brighten me up with his chat whilst performing his tasks very competently, he could have just come in dusted and wiped and gone out again, job done!  
I will always be grateful for the way I was cared for during what has been a very difficult time for everyone.

title: Great service
body: Excellent Annual general check up. On time, patient friendly and thorough review. Covid safe and reception was also welcoming.

title: Excellent caring
body:
I recently had surgery at the woodland Hospital in Kettering, the level  of care which I received was excellent.  Every member of staff was caring, kind and and really helpful and made me feel at ease. The consultant and Anethiest were also very kind and made me feel at ease. This was my first ever operation,the staff kept me informed  all the way. 
I would recommend this hospital. 
Thank you to all the staff that looked after me.
